findings.title: The withdraw function is improperly designed
findings.description: The _withdraw_ function is improperly designed, the payable keyword has no practical effect and is not used, “address(this).balance” is the platform currency, and the funds will be locked and cannot be withdrawn.

findings.title: Unfixed compiler version
findings.description: The project uses an unfixed or outdated compiler version which can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Cost variable setting error
findings.description: There may be a risk of transaction ordering dependencies, the function _setCost_ may be modified before the _mint_ function is called, thus paying a different price.

findings.title: _setmaxMintAmount_ , _setBaseURI_ , _setBaseExtension_ , _pause, setCost_ functions lack event triggering
findings.description: The functions lack event triggering which may cause issues with transaction ordering dependencies and variable settings.

findings.title: Risk of transaction ordering dependencies in the _setCost_ function
findings.description: There may be a risk of transaction ordering dependencies, the function _setCost_ may be modified before the _mint_ function is called, thus paying a different price.

findings.title: Missing error warning messages in _Mint_ functions
findings.description: Missing error warning messages in _Mint_ functions.
